comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Cryptocurrency, just a coin or token which using cryptography as the security and it's run in blockchain. Blockchain, just a public ledger where you can see any transaction, balance and the address. Cryptography, just a computer security using code or pattern.You don't have to understand anything, just know the reason why you want to invest in a particular coin, learn to buy it and how to hold it safely.

comments.author: Jon_Hodl
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. First off, I would like to encourage you to avoid "crypto" and focus solely on bitcoin. Almost all (if not 100%) cryptocurrencies are scams, frauds, ponzi schemes, etc. Your best bet is to stick with bitcoin because it is the only asset that is truly decentralized so there is nobody that can print more on a whim and reduce the amount that you have in relation to the total of 21,000,000. That being said, I would start with a lot of reading here on this forum as well as all of the best bitcoin books: https://www.whatisbitcoin.com/best-bitcoin-books as well as a lot of the articles on Bitcoin Magazine: https://bitcoinmagazine.com/Beyond that, I would just suggest that you keep stay curious, keep asking questions, and be teachable. Bitcoin is a journey and takes a lot of time to fully understand and use so be patient and enjoy your journey. It's a truly beautiful experience.¬† Welcome to Bitcoin.
